title: Add AGPL license file for dual licensing
Redesign tab loading indicator (replace dot with better UI)
Investigate patching edid-decode for byte buffer input/struct output
description:
Investigate patching linuxtv edid-decode to support:
1. Direct byte buffer input instead of file path (avoid FS overhead)
2. Return structured data (JSON/struct) instead of text output

This would improve WASM integration by:
- Eliminating virtual filesystem overhead
- Enabling direct data access from JS
- Better error handling with structured responses

Research areas:
- edid-decode source structure and parsing flow
- Emscripten bindings for direct memory access
- Upstream contribution possibility vs maintaining fork

title: Update README with npm installation and dual-license notice
Use edid-decode WASM for viewer component
description:
Replace our JS edid-decoder.js with linuxtv edid-decode compiled to WASM for the edid-viewer component, providing comprehensive spec-compliant parsing.

Keep minimal JS decoding in edid-selector for displaying basic info in results list (manufacturer ID, resolution, monitor name).

## Architecture

```
edid-selector (basic JS decode for list display)
  └── edid-decoder-basic.js  # Minimal: mfr ID, resolution, name only

edid-viewer (full WASM decode for detail view)
  └── edid-decode.wasm       # Full linuxtv edid-decode
  └── edid-decode-wrapper.js # JS API wrapper
```

## Tasks

1. **Build edid-decode WASM**
   - Clone v4l-utils or just edid-decode sources
   - Create Emscripten build (emcc)
   - Export function to parse EDID bytes → structured output
   - Target: ~100-300KB gzipped

2. **Create JS wrapper**
   - Async WASM loading with lazy init
   - `decodeEdid(Uint8Array) → ParsedEdid` API
   - Parse edid-decode text output or create C++ JSON export

3. **Slim down edid-decoder.js**
   - Keep only: header validation, mfr ID, product code, monitor name, preferred resolution
   - Rename to edid-decoder-basic.js (~100 lines)

4. **Update edid-viewer**
   - Load WASM on first use (lazy)
   - Show loading state while WASM initializes
   - Display full edid-decode output (text or structured)

5. **Update edid-selector**
   - Use basic decoder for results-table display
   - No WASM dependency for list view

## Considerations

- WASM lazy loading to avoid blocking initial page load
- Fallback to basic decoder if WASM fails
- Consider caching decoded results
- edid-decode outputs text; may need to parse or modify C++ to output JSON

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] edid-decode compiles to WASM with Emscripten
- [ ] WASM bundle < 500KB gzipped
- [ ] edid-viewer shows full edid-decode output
- [ ] edid-selector uses lightweight JS decoder for list
- [ ] WASM loads lazily (not blocking initial render)
- [ ] Fallback works if WASM unavailable

title: Simplify having both demo/index.html and index.html
Status bar: clickable log with message history
description:
When clicking the status bar, show a popup/modal with a timestamped log of all status messages.

## Features
- Timestamped message history
- Scrollable log view
- Optional: bytes loaded indicator (may need manifest to know total size)

## Considerations
- We know total count from manifest, but not total bytes without building/scanning
- Could show: X entries loaded, Y buckets fetched
- Or just show message history for debugging
